Detailed Description

This class represents a TinyJave block statement; local variables are not represented within a BlockStatement, but with a MethodDeclaration.

A block statement is a sequence of statements represented as a std::vector of Statement nodes.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

BlockStatement::BlockStatement ( int  lno  ) 

Create a new block statement node.

Parameters:
lno is a source line number (should be the beginning of the block).

void BlockStatement::addStatement ( Statement *  stmt  ) 

Add a statement to this block statement at the end.

Parameters:
stmt a Statement to be aded as the last in sequence.
Exceptions:
AstException if the argument is NULL

Return the statements of this block.

Returns:
a pointer to the std::vector with the Statement nodes
void BlockStatement::prependStatement ( Statement *  stmt  ) 

Add another statement to this block statement in the front.

Parameters:
stmt a Statement to be aded as the first in sequence.
Exceptions:
